abstract: Plaintiffs in the lawsuit, settled for $590 million, said the bank failed to disclose its huge holdings in collateralized debt obligations.
snippet: Plaintiffs in the lawsuit, settled for $590 million, said the bank failed to disclose its huge holdings in collateralized debt obligations.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup said on Wednesday that it had agreed to pay $590 million to settle a class-action lawsuit brought by shareholders who contended that they had been misled about the bank’s exposure to subprime mortgage debt on the eve of the financial crisis.

headline.main: Citigroup in $590 Million Settlement of Subprime Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Citigroup Settles Lawsuit Over Subprime Securities
